Abstract: This study explores the integration of nanotechnologies in developing physiology-informed drug delivery systems targeting the lymphatic system. By leveraging advancements in bioengineering and immunoengineering, novel biomaterials are engineered to enhance targeted delivery to lymph nodes. This approach aims to improve therapeutic efficacy and minimize systemic side effects, offering promising applications in treating lymphatic-related diseases. The research underscores the potential of nanotechnology in revolutionizing precision medicine through targeted lymphatic drug delivery.
